lore: Pit Worms are typically between six and ten feet in length. For some reason, most of them live far from population centers and trade routes. There are two theories in this regard: either intelligent creatures built their settlements based on the number of attacks by these creatures, or the Pit Worms somehow learned that the inhabitants of the surface are usually more dangerous than them.\n\nThe Spitting Pit Worm's saliva goes directly to the bloodstream, causing nausea and intestinal irritation.
menagerieDialog: (It never stops wriggling. Frankly, its mannerisms are a bit disconcerting.)
(One benefit of having this creature around is that you never need to worry about disposing of corpses.)
(It's making a disgusting noise with its mouth, not unlike a dog eating oatmeal.)
(It insists on making disgusting sucking noises with its mouth.)
name: Spitting Pit Worm
